title: How to Knit a Simple Bag

steps.headline: Border.
steps.description:
Work first 4 rows in moss stitch, using the correct sequence for an odd number of stitches:
Row 1: *(k1, p1) repeat from *to end. Row 2: *(k1, p1) repeat from *to end. Row 3: *(k1, p1) repeat from *to end. Row 4: *(k1, p1) repeat from *to end. Row 5: Knit.

steps.headline: Continue in stockinette stitch(*knit one row, purl second row, repeat from * to end) until the piece measures 25 centimeter (9.8 in).
Border.
steps.description: Work next 4 rows in moss stitch (also known as seed stitch). Cast off in moss stitch. Cut the yarn, leaving sufficient yarn to sew up. Repeat.

steps.headline: Border.
steps.description: Rows 1-4: work 4 rows in moss stitch. Continue in stocking stitch until the handle measures 35 centimeter (13.8 in) (or length required).

steps.headline: Border.
steps.description: Work next 4 rows in moss stitch. Cast off in moss stitch. Cut the yarn, leaving sufficient yarn to sew up.

steps.headline: Border.
steps.description: Work 4 rows in moss stitch. Continue in stocking stitch until the pocket measures 12 centimeter (4.7 in), ending with a knit row. Cast off in knit stitch. Cut the yarn, leaving sufficient to sew up.

steps.headline: Position the pocket in the center of the front piece, pin, and then slip stitch into place.
Sew the buttons onto the handles in the center of the moss stitch border.
Measure 10 centimeter (3.9 in) from left side edge of the bag and insert a pin here vertically, starting just below the moss stitch border.
steps.description: This is a marker for the center of the handle. Repeat from right side edge.

steps.headline: Position the handle so that the moss stitch border is on the handle just below the moss stitch border on the bag, in line with the marker pin.
steps.description: Pin in place, remove the marker pin and then slip stitch in place, attaching all of the handle.

steps.headline: Attach both handles as in the steps above.
steps.description: Match up the front and back pieces with the moss stitch border at the top and join the side and bottom seams using mattress stitch. # Tidy up all loose ends.

steps.headline: Fill with knitting goodies and accessories purse.

text:
Bag Cast on 45 stitches.  Border. Work first 4 rows in moss stitch, using the correct sequence for an odd number of stitches:
Row 1: *(k1, p1) repeat from *to end. Row 2: *(k1, p1) repeat from *to end. Row 3: *(k1, p1) repeat from *to end. Row 4: *(k1, p1) repeat from *to end. Row 5: Knit. Continue in stockinette stitch(*knit one row, purl second row, repeat from * to end) until the piece measures 25 centimeter (9.8 in).  Border. Work next 4 rows in moss stitch (also known as seed stitch). Cast off in moss stitch. Cut the yarn, leaving sufficient yarn to sew up. Repeat. Handles Handles. Cast on 7 stitches. Border. Rows 1-4: work 4 rows in moss stitch. Continue in stocking stitch until the handle measures 35 centimeter (13.8 in) (or length required). Border. Work next 4 rows in moss stitch. Cast off in moss stitch. Cut the yarn, leaving sufficient yarn to sew up. Pocket Pocket. Cast on 16 stitches. Border. Work 4 rows in moss stitch. Continue in stocking stitch until the pocket measures 12 centimeter (4.7 in), ending with a knit row. Cast off in knit stitch. Cut the yarn, leaving sufficient to sew up. Finishing Position the pocket in the center of the front piece, pin, and then slip stitch into place.  Sew the buttons onto the handles in the center of the moss stitch border.  Measure 10 centimeter (3.9 in) from left side edge of the bag and insert a pin here vertically, starting just below the moss stitch border. This is a marker for the center of the handle. Repeat from right side edge. Position the handle so that the moss stitch border is on the handle just below the moss stitch border on the bag, in line with the marker pin. Pin in place, remove the marker pin and then slip stitch in place, attaching all of the handle. Attach both handles as in the steps above. Match up the front and back pieces with the moss stitch border at the top and join the side and bottom seams using mattress stitch. # Tidy up all loose ends. Fill with knitting goodies and accessories purse.
sentences:
Work first 4 rows in moss stitch, using the correct sequence for an odd number of stitches:
Row 1: *(k1, p1) repeat from *to end.
Continue in stockinette stitch(*knit one row, purl second row, repeat from * to end) until the piece measures 25 centimeter (9.8 in).
Work next 4 rows in moss stitch (also known as seed stitch).
Cut the yarn, leaving sufficient yarn to sew up.
Rows 1-4: work 4 rows in moss stitch.
Continue in stocking stitch until the handle measures 35 centimeter (13.8 in) (or length required).
Work next 4 rows in moss stitch.
Cut the yarn, leaving sufficient yarn to sew up.
Continue in stocking stitch until the pocket measures 12 centimeter (4.7 in), ending with a knit row.
Cut the yarn, leaving sufficient to sew up.
Finishing Position the pocket in the center of the front piece, pin, and then slip stitch into place.
Sew the buttons onto the handles in the center of the moss stitch border.
Measure 10 centimeter (3.9 in) from left side edge of the bag and insert a pin here vertically, starting just below the moss stitch border.
This is a marker for the center of the handle.
Position the handle so that the moss stitch border is on the handle just below the moss stitch border on the bag, in line with the marker pin.
Pin in place, remove the marker pin and then slip stitch in place, attaching all of the handle.
Attach both handles as in the steps above.
Match up the front and back pieces with the moss stitch border at the top and join the side and bottom seams using mattress stitch.
Fill with knitting goodies and accessories purse.
tyn_section: Sewing needle and sewing cotton (for buttons)
